intro: Psittacanthus sulcatus, commonly known as the zigzag fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, undulating fronds that give it its common name. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with long, creeping stems that produce aerial roots. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a leathery texture, often with a bluish-green hue. Psittacanthus sulcatus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
